intro: Sonchus goraeensis, commonly known as the mountain sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, silver-green leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits called achenes. Sonchus goraeensis is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
